newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: INSTANT VIEW-RBA's Macfarlane parliamentry address.
newsitem.headline: INSTANT VIEW-RBA's Macfarlane parliamentry address.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) said in its semi-annual monetary policy statement that the current level of cash rates are accommodating a pick-up in the economy.
It also said recent wages data suggests wages growth is becoming uncomfortably high and any further acceleration would need a policy response.
The report was part of RBA governor Ian Macfarlane's address to a parliamentry finance committee, the first of his semi-annual testimonies.
A selection of economists' immediate reactions to Macfarlane's comments follow:
